dialogues.text: After brushing his teeth, Toller stops to examine his fac the mirror. He has lost weight. His skin seems a bit on t yellow side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIMECUT. NIGHT. Toller, in thought, walks around the parsonage. He goes to the closet, removes box where Micha EXPLOSIVE VEST has been placed. He removes the vest, examines the disconnected detonator wires. It’s a fearsome sight. TIMECUT. He researches types and characteristics of suici vests and belts. Some of the literature is in English, so in Arabic. There are five types of vests, some utilizing dynamite, others Semtex, others C4. They vary in design and detonat features. Toller locates the vest before him: “Semtex Blocks #2. Ha Style.” Foil wrapped 2500 gram vertical rectangles of Sem attached to a Velcro belt with bungee cord and connected wires to a push button detonator. He examines the vest. It’s beautiful and simple in design power and intent. Web images show GIF of a suicide bomber attacks. TIMECUT. He writes in his journal. Next to him rests a ha filled glass of scotch. He pours Pepto Bismol into the whiskey glass. Pink viscus fluid diffuses through clear amber. He takes a sip.  85

dialogues.speaker: 85A
dialogues.text: 86 87 88 TIMECUT. Toller lifts the vest, slips his arms into the straps, connects the Velcro tabs, looks at himself in the mirror. Adjusts the vests. Clerical. In a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late night. He sleeps in bed atop the blanket. Still dres he wears the vest.

dialogues.speaker: TOLLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “Behold, I show you a mystery. We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOLLER, walking the barbed wire which shakes through the hedgerow perimeter, stops when he notices something. A dead squirrel has gotten caught in drooping barbed wire Toller uses his scratched bleeding hands to loosen the squirrel from the wire. He pulls at the wire compulsively wrapping into a roll.

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCH
dialogues.text: INT. TOLLER’S CAR - DAY 89 Toller is on the move in his Toyota. Driving here, drivin there. America outside his car windows. Beautiful, sad, violated, polluted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling industrial complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toller walks behind a school group touring the Balq paper mill. They watch as massive machines transform pulp into paper.

dialogues.speaker: TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: Balg Home Products, makers of paper goods, fertilizers, everyday items for the household, was among the first companies to realize the need to address environmental concerns. Balgq is green...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toller drives past the four story dark glass corporate headquarters: Balq Industries.

dialogues.speaker: TOLLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Today I stopped. I had Miso and fish. When was the last time? Such simple pleasures. Why do we deny ourselves?  94 Toller, at the bar, sips sake as Ed Balg dines with top t business companions at an overpriced restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TOLLER’'S CAR - SUBURBS - AFTERNOON 94 LUXURIOUS SUBURB. Toller drives the battered Toyota past manicured megahomes. Very much out of place, he checks th rear view mirror. A SECURITY SUV is following him. INSERT OF JOURNAL: Several pages torn out followed by the words:

dialogues.speaker: TOLLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I've removed the previous pages. They were written in a delirium. But I am determined to continue. It’s hard to struggle against torpor. I must set pen to paper. In the gated suburb, Toller slows down as if checking a h number. The Security SUV pulls up behind him, FLASHES its lights. Toller pulls to the curb. The SECURITY OFFICER gets out, walks over to him. The Officer gives him a suspicious onc over. Toller’s sweater is dirty, he needs a haircut, a shave...

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: May I be of some assistance?

dialogues.speaker: TOLLER

dialogues.text: He listened. He was kind. We did something we called the Magical Mystery Tour. It sounds silly. We'd share a joint then we would lie on top of each other fully clothed. Try to get as much body to body contact as possible. He also called it the 80% Solution. Hands out, look each right into the eyes. Then move our eyes in unison, right, left, right, left. dialogues.text: No, just listen to the breaths. Toller gets on the carpet, stretches out. Mary stands, removes her coat, then carefully lowers herself atop him. Forehead to forehead, finger to finger, thigh and leg to thigh and leg. Her baby against his belly. She stares deep into his eyes. He breathes slowly. He pac his breaths to match hers. She moves her eyes left to right. He syncs his eye moveme with hers. She looks right to left, he looks right to lef They slip into a meditative trance. Breathe in, breathe o A single organism. Slowly, they LEVITATE. They float horizontally three feet above the floor. Then they ROTATE 360 degrees, not moving a fraction. Side side, Toller uppermost, side by side, Mary on top again. Then the PARSONAGE FALLS AWAY and they are in flight acro the face of the earth. They FLOAT across the wonders on earth, the peaks of the Himalayas, the Ignacu Falls, the fertile jungles of Amazo and Australian outback. And the hideous spoilage man has wreaked: the waste dumps India, the choking smog of China, the toxic rivers of Indonesia, the oil coated birds and fish of the Gulf Coas
